roles.name: Coach
roles.description: Trains athletes or teams, devising strategies, planning practice sessions, and providing feedback to maximize performance.

meta.typicalBackground: Sports science, competition experience, leadership and motivational skills
challenges: Balancing individual skill development with team tactics, preventing injuries, psychological pressure

sampleUseCase.scenario: A soccer coach introduces specialized drills focusing on defensive shape, reducing conceded goals by 40% in the next tournament.

roles.name: Sports Agent
roles.description: Represents athletes’ professional interests, negotiates contracts, handles endorsements, and manages public profiles.

meta.typicalBackground: Law or business degree, strong negotiation skills, sports industry network
keyTools: Contract drafting, brand partnership strategies, market salary benchmarks
challenges: Maintaining athlete's public image, ensuring fair deals, competition from rival agencies

sampleUseCase.scenario: An agent secures a multi-year endorsement deal for a rising basketball star, leveraging social media analytics to prove the athlete’s marketing value.

roles.name: Event Organizer
roles.description: Plans and executes sports events—from local competitions to large-scale tournaments—coordinating venues, scheduling, sponsorship, and logistics.

meta.typicalBackground: Event management or sports administration, budgeting, vendor coordination, crowd control measures
challenges: Securing adequate facilities, ensuring safety (emergency services), unpredictability of weather for outdoor events

sampleUseCase.scenario: An organizer sets up a city marathon, working with law enforcement for road closures, recruiting sponsors for prizes, and implementing real-time runner tracking for spectators.

roles.name: Sports Medicine Specialist
roles.description: Provides medical support to athletes, diagnosing and treating injuries, developing rehabilitation programs, ensuring safe return to play.

meta.typicalBackground: Medical degree or physiotherapy, specialized sports medicine training, knowledge of athletic injury prevention
keyTools: Rehabilitation equipment, imaging (MRI, X-ray), concussion protocols
challenges: Pressure to return athletes quickly, balancing performance vs. risk of re-injury, doping or painkiller misuse issues

sampleUseCase.scenario: A sports physician detects early signs of ACL strain in a soccer player, prescribes targeted exercises and modifies training load, preventing a major knee injury.

roles.name: Performance Analyst
roles.description: Collects and interprets performance data (GPS, video, stats) to provide strategic insights for coaches and athletes.

meta.typicalBackground: Sports science or data analytics, ability to interpret metrics in context of specific sports tactics
keyTools: GPS trackers, motion capture, video breakdown software, analytics dashboards
challenges: Filtering data overload, ensuring real-time feedback, aligning with coaching philosophy

sampleUseCase.scenario: A performance analyst discovers inefficiencies in a basketball team's defensive rotations using video breakdown. They highlight these in training sessions, boosting the team’s defensive rating.
